intro: Triumfetta keniensis, commonly known as the Kenyan triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, pink or white flowers and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
